widget.tooltip: Enter the maximum number of items to add in any one feed.
widget.help: The Feed system generates feeds by adding items found in a list. As your website grows, so does your feed, if you do not impose any limit. The top maximum number of items in any feed parameter is used to impose such a limit. If your website has more than that many pages that could be included in your feed, then the Feed system limits to that many and stops. This maximum is applied to all your feeds. You may change the feed maximum too.

widget.label: Allow the main feed RSS file format to appear under /rss.xml.
widget.tooltip: Check this checkmark to allow /rss.xml to point to /feed/main/main.rss (with an internal redirect meaning that we won't generate a 301 Redirect.)
widget.help: By clicking this checkmark, you allow the main feed RSS file to be duplicated in /rss.xml. Make sure to turn this checkmark off if you delete the main feed.

widget.label: Allow the main feed Atom file format to appear under /atom.xml.
widget.tooltip: Check this checkmark to allow /atom.xml to point to /feed/main/main.atom (with an internal redirect meaning that we won't generate a 301 Redirect.)
widget.help: By clicking this checkmark, you allow the main feed Atom file to be duplicated in /atom.xml. Make sure to turn this checkmark off if you delete the main feed.

widget.label: Publish the whole article when checked. Otherwise make use of a teaser (see parameters below.)
widget.tooltip: Select to publish whole pages in your feed.
widget.help: In most cases, you want to only publish a teaser inyour feeds (teaser is as defined below.) This option allows you to turn off the teaser function and use the whole page instead.

widget.tooltip: Enter the number of words that should appear in your feed teasers.
widget.help: The Feed system generates its own teaser for each feed item. This parameter indicates the number of words to display in the feed. Usually you want between 200 and 300 words in a teaser.

widget.tooltip: Enter the maximum number of tags that should be added to your feed teaser.
widget.help: The Feed system generates its own teaser for each feed item. This parameter indicates the number of tags to include in such a teaser. In most cases, you do not limit the number of tags. To do so, use a large number such as 1000.

widget.tooltip: Enter the text to display at the bottom of the teaser to let users know that there is more to read.
widget.help: The Feed system generates its own teaser for each feed item. This parameter represents the text to append at the end of the teaser to indicate when more data is available. This is often the elipsis (...), eventually between square brackets ([...]). The Feed system does not allow adding a link to the page so please avoid using something such as Read more... since it won't be clickable.
